definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: All of those cancers are relatively rare.
sentences.chinese: 以上癌症都是极为罕有的。

sentences.english: The unusually big suspension allows the woofer to perform big membrane movements.
sentences.chinese: 这种罕有的大悬浮设计使低音能够执行大膜移动。

sentences.english: Henry wins the day achieving one of the greatest battlefield reversals of all time.
sentences.chinese: 亨利终于成就了一场历史上罕有的以少胜多的战役。

sentences.english: I bargained with him for some rare stamps.
sentences.chinese: 我与他讲价，想买些罕有的邮票。

sentences.english: An uncustomary access of rage shook my body.
sentences.chinese: 一阵突然爆发的罕有愤怒使我全身发抖。

sentences.english: Even a Starbucks on Madison Avenue didn't open.
sentences.chinese: 麦迪逊小道上标志性的星巴克都罕有地打烊收歇。

sentences.english: Primary malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) of the lung is rare and most reported cases are in late adulthood.
sentences.chinese: 肺原发性恶性纤维组织细胞瘤是非常罕有的肿瘤。

sentences.english: Faithfulness has always been a rare quality.
sentences.chinese: 忠心一直是罕有的特质。

sentences.english: What's the most unusual thing you've seen at the grocery store recently?
sentences.chinese: 最近，你在食品店看到最罕有的东西是什么？

sentences.english: Nowadays, depression and psychosis disorder seems so common in such a stressful city.
sentences.chinese: 现今压力都市，情绪病并不会是一件罕有的事情。

definition: one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
